verses.roman:
antare-bāhire kṛṣṇa-viraha-taraṅga
nānā-bhāve vyākula prabhura mana āra aṅga

synonyms: antare-bāhire—internally and externally; kṛṣṇa-viraha-taraṅga—the waves of separation from Kṛṣṇa; nānā-bhāve—by various ecstasies; vyākula—agitated; prabhura—of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; mana āra aṅga—mind and body.
translation: Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu always felt waves of separation from Kṛṣṇa, externally and internally. His mind and body were agitated by various spiritual transformations.
